score.title:
You are a
Conscious Conservative
score.description:
You are more interested in keeping your money instead of growing it. While you may be satisfied with little returns on your investments, remember that this may make you more vulnerable to the impacts of inflation.

Interested in the in-depth analysis of your investing persona?

score.title:
You are a
Passive Preserver
score.description:
You have a relaxed and stress-free approach towards your investments. Financial security and wealth preservation are your top priorities so you tend to be more passive when building your portfolio. Be mindful not to let your investments go stagnant and at risk of loss due to inflation.

Interested in the in-depth analysis of your investing persona?

score.title:
You are a
Friendly Follower
score.description:
You are largely influenced by your peers when it comes to investment decisions. Without much input into your portfolio, you may not be aware of your true financial potential and how to achieve it.

Interested in the in-depth analysis of your investing persona?

score.title:
You are an
Independent Individualist
score.description:
You have a hands-on approach to investing. You listen to your instincts and closely manage your portfolio. It is easy to get distracted by short-term market movements and detract from your investment plans. Do evaluate your plans from time to time and stay focused on your long-term goals.

Interested in the in-depth analysis of your investing persona?

score.title:
You are an
Active Accumulator
score.description:
You take an active approach to building your portfolio and accumulating wealth. You are an early adopter and is willing to explore new investment opportunities. Try not to let your adventurous spirit get the better of you by evaluating your risk profile and investment goals from time to time.

Interested in the in-depth analysis of your investing persona?

question.question: How would your friends describe you?

answers.value: Grounded and stable - I am definitely the least problematic in our group.
I am their go-to friend - they know I am always there for them.
Creature of habit - I know what I like and I will stick to my usual routine.
Interesting - always up-to-date with the latest news and trends.
Ambitious and determined - I have to-do lists to achieve all my goals.

question.question: When you travel, how do you plan your holidays?

answers.value: Holiday? I would rather spend on something tangible or save the money.
I love staycations. No planning, no hassle and most times, easy on the budget.
Me, planning? I leave all that with my travel buddies.
I love to take charge - accommodation, places to see and what to eat. I would even go on my own if others do not want to.
I am an experience seeker. Every trip must include a new experience.

question.question: You are at a beach holiday with your friends. How are you spending it?

answers.value: I am making the most of my hotel room as getting a tan would be disastrous.
I am staying on the beach with my book and favourite Pina Colada.
I will go wherever my friends are going.
I have got my itinerary all planned out. See you later!
I have never tried Jet Blading. Let's go! What are we waiting for?

question.question: You see a new flavour "Mala Coffee" at the cafe. What will you order?

answers.value: Just my usual Latte. It is better to be safe than sorry.
My usual - but do I want it hot or cold? Should I get a cake? Maybe not…
Is my friend getting that? I will try it if my friend tries it too.
Mala Coffee, of course! I love to try new flavours.
Hang on...I might want to try but let me check out the reviews first.

question.question: It is your turn to pick a dinner place with your friends. What would you do?

answers.value: Cozy at-home dinner - we can do pot luck or get takeaways.
Everybody loved the last restaurant we went to - so let’s go there again.
Ask my colleagues for recommendations - they will know better than Google.
I already booked the new restaurant in town - it is on my restaurant wishlist.
Ever tried dining in the dark or molecular cuisines? I will make the reservations.

question.question: What is your ideal mode of transport?

answers.value: Walking, if it is near and bus or train if it is a distance away.
Buses and trains - they are the most reliable.
Everybody takes Grab these days.
It depends on what makes sense at the moment - I do not mind walking, public transport, or taking the Segway.
A car is so much faster and more convenient to get around.

question.question: Oh no! Your phone shattered on the sidewalk. Time to buy a new one. Which sounds most like you?

answers.value: Let's see who has a spare phone while I research for the best phone in the market.
I will just get the exact same one - no stress.
There is this new model that everybody wants - so I want it too!
I need to do more research - but I am definitely not going for the obvious choices.
Definitely the latest model. It will have a higher resale value.

question.question: Your boss just gave you the day off. How will you spend it?

answers.value: This is my chance to catch up on all my favourite dramas and movies that I have missed.
Resetting. Yoga and a walk in the park should do the trick.
Meeting up with my friends - different friends for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
It is me-time! I have always wanted to spend the whole day at the art gallery.
Let me start checking off my to-do list.

question.question: You received S$800 cash for your birthday. What would you do with the money?

answers.value: Put it into my savings account.
Make this money work harder for me by putting it into my investment portfolio.
Take my friends out for dinner and get suggestions for a present I long deserve.
Split it into three: one for emergency fund, another to treat myself, and lastly into my regular savings plan.
Buy undervalued investments that has great potential in the future that no one else is talking about yet.

question.question: You just started going to the gym. How soon do you expect to see results?

answers.value: Since I am not going regularly, perhaps 1-3 years?
Hopefully as soon as possible - otherwise I will quickly lose motivation.
I am not sure - I joined the gym so that I can workout with my friends.
I have a strict gym plan, which shows different progression stages and key milestones, so I know exactly what results to get at which point.
It does not matter much - I am in this for the long term.
Nothing fancy. Just need to get me from one point to another safely.
Nothing too fancy, just needs to be efficient in consuming petrol.
My friends all have the same model of car, so I want that as well.
The latest model with all the best features.
Definitely a fast car. I am in for torque and horsepower.
